item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We shouldn't live as if [other worlds] mattered more than this life in this world, because where we are is always the most important place." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Joy is to fun what the deep sea is to a puddle. Itâ€™s a feeling inside that can hardly be contained." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Wilfred Owen
item.description:
"Bent double, like old beggars under sacks, Knocked-kneed, coughing like hags, we cursed through sludge, Till on the haunting flares we turned our backs And towards our distant rest began to trudge. Men marched asleep. Many had lost their boots But limped on, blood-shod. All went lame; all blind; Drunk with fatigue; deaf even to the hoots Of tired, outstripped Five-Nines that dropped behind.
Gas! Gas! Quick, boys-An ecstasy of fumbling, Fitting the clumsy helmets just in time; But someone still was yelling out and stumbling And flound'ring like a man in fire or lime... Dim, through the mist panes and thick green light, As under a green sea, I saw him drowning.
If in some smothering dreams you too could pace Behind the wagon that we flung him in, And watch the white eyes writhing in his face, His hanging face, like a devil's sick of sin; If you could hear, at every jolt, the blood Come gurgling form the froth-corrupted lungs, Obscene as cancer, bitter as cud Of vile, incurable sores on the innocent tongues,- My friend, you would not tell with such high zest To children ardent for some desperate glory, The old lie: Dulce et decorum est Pro patria mori." -- Wilfred Owen

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Wilfred Owen
item.description: "If in some smothering dreams you too could pace Behind the wagon that we flung him in, And watch the white eyes writhing in his face, His hanging face, like a devil's sick of sin; If you could hear, at every jolt, the blood Come gargling from the froth-corrupted lungs, Obscene as cancer, bitter as the cud Of vile, incurable sores on innocent tongues,-- My friend, you would not tell with such high zest To children ardent for some desperate glory, The old Lie: Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori." -- Wilfred Owen

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "These violent delights have violent ends And in their triump die, like fire and powder Which, as they kiss, consume" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Did my heart love till now? forswear it, sight! For I ne'er saw true beauty till this night." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "For never was a story of more woe than this of Juliet and her Romeo." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You are a lover. Borrow Cupid's wings and soar with them above a common bound." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Some Cupid kills with arrows, some with traps. " -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description:
"Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain I am loved of all ladies, only you excepted: and I would I could find in my heart that I had not a hard heart; for, truly, I love none.
Beatrice: A dear happiness to women: they would else have been troubled with a pernicious suitor. I thank God and my cold blood, I am of your humour for that: I had rather hear my dog bark at a crow than a man swear he loves me. -Much Ado About Nothing" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "And to be merry best becomes you; for, out of question, you were born in a merry hour. BEATRICE No, sure, my lord, my mother cried; but then there was a star danced, and under that was I born." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "The train is roaring toward you and the villain is twirling his moustache and you're fussing that he's tied you to the tracks with the wrong kind of rope." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Roses are for love. Not silly sweet-hearts' love but the love that makes you and keeps you whole, love that gets you through the worst your life'll give you and that pours out of you when you're given the best instead." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "The Lone Ranger of vampires. Did that make me Tonto?" -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Can't all beasts be tamed?" -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Feeling at peace, however fragilely, made it easy to slip into the visionary end of the dark-sight. The rose shadows said that they loved the sun, but that they also loved the dark, where their roots grew through the lightless mystery of the earth. The roses said: <i> You do not have to choose. </i>" -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Vampires do breathe, by the way, but their chests don't move like humans'. Have you ever lain in the arms of your sweetheart and tried to match your breathing to his, or hers? You do it automatically. Your brain only gets involved if your body is having trouble. Fortunately there was nothing about this situation that was like being in the arms of a sweetheart except that I was leaning against someone's naked chest. I could no more have breathed with him than I could have ignited gasoline and shot exhaust out my butt because I was sitting in the passenger seat of a car." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "My capacity for invention is flash hot stark, I thought. Sucker sunshade. Disembodied radar-reconnaissance. Not to mention Bitter Chocolate Death and Killer Zebras. Pity about the rest of me." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "...but with the hours I sometimes kept at the coffeehouse I had to have learned to take naps during the day or die, and I had learned to take naps. Up until five months ago "something or other or die" had always seemed like a plain choice in favor of the something or other." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "Those single-track military minds never think to ask their cleaning staff for help in giant lethal marauding creature matters." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Jennifer Rardin
item.description: "Who brings baby pictures on an international flight?" I hissed. "If I'd wanted my bare ass paraded in front of all the first-class ticket holders I'd have mooned everyone before we took off!" -- Jennifer Rardin

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Jennifer Rardin
item.description: "The padlock clicked open. A voice soundingoddly like South Parks's Cartman echoed through my quivering brain. Goddammit! " -- Jennifer Rardin

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Jennifer Rardin
Yasmin add a quote by Jennifer Rardin
Yasmin add a quote by P.C. Cast
item.description: "Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good." -- P.C. Cast

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by P.C. Cast
item.description: "The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express." -- P.C. Cast

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by P.C. Cast & Kristin Cast
item.description: "Night can't cloak your scarlet dream. Accept Desire's call." -- P.C. Cast & Kristin Cast

item.title: Yasmin add a quote by Trudi Canavan
item.description: "It is said, in Imardin, that the wind has a soul, and that it wails through the narrow streets because it is grieved by what it finds there." -- Trudi Canavan
